com.yantra.api.ycp.prints

Interface printDocumentSet

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    YIFApi, com.yantra.api.YSCApi

    public interface printDocumentSet

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document printDocumentSet(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      printDocumentSet prints multiple operational reports or labels.

    • Method Detail

      • printDocumentSet

        org.w3c.dom.Document printDocumentSet(YFSEnvironment env,
                                      org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                               throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                      java.rmi.RemoteException

        printDocumentSet prints multiple operational reports or labels.
        The processing is as follows:

        1. List of PrintDocument in a PrintDocuments element are processed in order.
        2. Each PrintDocument node corresponds to an operational report or a label.
        3. In a PrintDocument node, the document specified in BeforeChildrenPrintDocumentId attribute is considered first, then the documents specified within the child PrintDocuments node are considered, and at last the document specified in AfterChildrenPrintDocumentId attribute is considered. A PrintDocument node can consist of one PrintDocuments node, which in turn can consist of multiple PrintDocument nodes. Hence, PrintDocuments node is recursive in nature. Nested PrintDocuments will be used if intermixing of documents is required.
          Example: If the Requirement is such that After each Packing Slip for a Shipment , UCC 128 Shipping Labels for all the Containers in the Shipment is to be printed, then PrintDocument node specifying the UCC 128 Shipping Labels, should be nested within the PrintDocument node specifying the Packing Slip. If on the other hand the requirement is to print all the PackingSlips together , then print all the UCC 128 Shipping Labels, in this scenario nesting of PrintDocument node is not necessary. Instead, seperate PrintDocument nodes have to be specified for Packing Slip and UCC 128 Shipping Labels.
        4. The data required for generating the labels is obtained from the InputData node by invoking a service, specified by the FlowName or an API, specified by the APIName. If neither APIName or FlowName attributes are provided, then the First Child Element of the InputData node is considered as the XML providing the data required. InputData node is also recursive in nature, hence, each InputData node can consist of a child InputData node, in which case the output obtained after processing the parent InputData node is passed to the child InputData node. The input in the child InputData node can refer to the output of the parent InputData node by the node name specified in the ParentDataElement attribute. The output obtained after processing the innermost InputData node is used to print the documents specified in the PrintDocument node. The XPath Bindings specified in the Mapping XML for a LabelFormat are resolved on the XML obtained after processing the innermost InputData node.
          Example : This example illustrates the recursive nature of InputData node. If the InputData node is specified as below : 
          <InputData APIName="getShipmentContainerList">
                    <Container ShipmentKey=""/>
                    <Template>
                        <Containers>
                            <Container ShipmentContainerKey=""/>
                        </Containers>
                    </Template>
                     <InputData APIName="getShipmentContainerDetails" ParentDataElement="Container">
                        <Container ShipmentContainerKey="@ShipmentContainerKey"/>
                    </InputData>
                </InputData>
          In this example, getShipmentContainerList API is invoked first, with the ShipmentKey, to obtain a List of ShipmentContainers for the Shipment. The APIName attribute of the child InputData node specifies that getShipmentContainerDetails will be invoked.The value of ParentDataElement attribute specifies the node which has to be carried over from Parent InputData to the child InputData. In this example, Since, multiple Container nodes can be present after invoking getShipmentContainerList API for each Container node the getShipmentContainerDetails API will be invoked after resolving the binding of ShipmentContainerKey from the parent Container element. Hence, the InputData element given in the example will invoke getShipmentContainerDetails API for each Container in the Shipment, specified by the value of the ShipmentKey attribute.
        5. The Printer for a label is obtained by invoking getPrinter API using PrintDocumentId, PrinterId and PrinterPreferences. If the PrinterPreferences node specifies XML Bindings (like, xml:/Shipment/@Modifyuserid), then they will be resolved from the XML generated after processing the InputData node.
        6. The Label Format is obtained by invoking getLabelFormat API using PrintDocumentId, LabelFormatId and LabelPreferences. If the LabelPreferences node speifies XML Bindings (like, xml:/Shipment/@SellerOrganizationCode), then they will be resolved from the XML generated after processing the InputData node.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue.YCPDeterminePrintJobNameUE

        Audits: None

        Pre Conditions: None

        Post Conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the set of print documents. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
